title: Third and final suspect arrested in MLK Day shooting in San Antonio that killed 2, injured 5
content:
SAN ANTONIO — The third and final suspect in a Martin Luther King Day shooting that left two dead and many injured on the East Side has been arrested.
Adrian Perkins, 24, will face a charge of capital murder.
Perkins is believed to be one of three gunmen who opened fire on a car wash at North New Braunfels Avenue and Gibbs Jan. 19, killing Vontay Jamar Price, 22, and Royal Willrich, 30.
His suspected accomplices, Edwin Joseph and Jacquay Howard, were already behind bars when Perkins was arrested.
During the shooting, the three suspects could be seen with an AK-47, a .40 caliber handgun, and a .380 handgun, detectives said, citing surveillance footage.
The man with an AK-47 allegedly fired several shots into a crowd of people, followed by the man with a .40 caliber handgun, police said. The third suspect was seen firing a single shot.
Including the two dead, seven people were hit, police said
